reasoning: Follicular adenoma is the most common benign thyroid neoplasm, with incidence estimates around 30-40 per 100k person-years based on population-based ultrasound screening studies. Global estimate reflects weighted average across regions with varying screening intensity and iodine sufficiency status.
source: Ezzat S et al. (2005). Thyroid nodules and differentiated thyroid cancer: American Association of Clinical Endocrinologists and Associazione Medici Endocrinologi Medical Guidelines. Endocr Pract. 11(3):204-224
